name: Vegetable Vindaloo
author: Anjali Shah
description: Mixed vegetable vindaloo is warm, comforting, and packed with flavor! Featuring homemade vindaloo paste and a medley of fresh vegetables, it's a great hearty dinner option. Plus, it's vegan and gluten-free!
instructions: Prepare the vindaloo paste by adding all paste ingredients into a blender and blend to a smooth paste. Scraping down the edges several times and blending again if needed.
Next, heat the coconut oil in a large pot over a medium-high heat and saute the paste for 2-3 minutes.
Stir in the vegetable broth and add the diced potatoes, bring to a simmer.
Cook for 5 minutes before adding the cauliflower florets, beans, bell pepper, tomato paste and diced tomatoes.
Stir and continue to simmer gently for 20-30 minutes or until the vegetables have cooked through. Stirring occasionally to prevent the sauce from burning.
Add the garam masala and adjust the seasoning to taste.
Serve with rice and naan bread.
notes: Cut the cauliflower into small florets to help with faster cooking.
Adjust the spice by increasing or decreasing the amount of dried red pepper flakes.
The vindaloo paste can be made ahead of time and stored in a sealable jar in the fridge for up to 2 days.
Store leftovers in the fridge for up to 4 days. Can be frozen for up to 1 month.
